page.title: 04Combe and Higher Combe
page.content: These twin hamlets occupy a particularly attractive site in the valley of the River Mardle. Combe stretches for about half a mile between Cullaford Bridge and Combe Bridge, and includes a group of cottages which were formerly used by woolcombers, and the parish hall, which was the local school until 1934. Above Combe Bridge is Higher Combe, which includes Mardle Wood House, once a woollen mill; The Old Chimney, which was the engine house of a copper mine (part of the chimney stack can still be seen); and The Bungalow, which started life as an Exmouth beach chalet, and was originally bought for Â£45.
